AliasInternalFrame.autologon.security.to: DB-Session will be opened without stopping at login dialog. Requires saved user and password.

"Auto logon" allows to conveniently open a DB-Session. This requires saved user and password.
To increase security check "Save password encrypted" which will prevent plain passwords from occurring in SQuirreL's configuration files.
Be aware that by consulting SQuirreL's source code encrypted passwords can be decrypted.
For maximum security do not enter passwords in this dialog and uncheck "Auto logon".

SessionObjectTreePropertiesPanel.filterN:
Object tree display filters for Catalogs, Schemas, and other DB-Objects (Tables, Views, ...) may be configured here. Filters are given as comma separated lists and may use the follwing placeholders:
% means zero or many characters
_ means one single character
Note:
These filters only influence displays in the Object tree nonetheless objects are still loaded. To influence Object loading use Alias Schema properties.

SessionSQLPropertiesPanel.loadColsInBack:
Loading columns in background might help users with databases that contain a 
  lot of objects and/or users that work with low data transfer rates. Syntax highlightning and code completion may work less 
  exact if this option is checked. It is recommended to use this option only if you feel that the SQL editor hangs.
SessionSQLPropertiesPanel.metaDataTimeOu:
In an open Session SQuirreL at several occasions reads database meta data, e.g. when loading columns, creating table charts, generating joins. 
  In case your database driver/connection sometimes delays or hangs you may set this timeout to keep SQuirreL from delaying or hanging. When a time out occurs an error is written to SQuirreL's logs.
SessionSQLPropertiesPanel.showSQLErrorsI: Show SQL execution errors in result tab
SessionSQLPropertiesPanel.readOnWarning:
The "Read on" option reads more rows when scrolling to the end of SQL results. It has the following drawbacks:
1. JDBC-Statements and ResultSets have to be kept open as long as the result tab is displayed.
2. Stored procedures that return more than one result set can't be supported because asking a JDBC-Statement for more results intrinsically closes former result sets.
3. Because Statement.setMaxResults() isn't called performance problems may arise with some RDBMs/JDBC drivers.
ResultLimitAndReadOnPanelSmallPanel.read:
The "Read on" option reads more rows when scrolling to the end of SQL results. It has the following drawbacks:
  1. JDBC-Statements and ResultSets have to be kept open as long as the result tab is displayed.
  2. Stored procedures that return more than one result set can't be supported because asking a JDBC-Statement for more results intrinsically closes former result sets.
  3. Because Statement.setMaxResults() isn't called performance problems may arise with some RDBMs/JDBC drivers.
SessionSQLPropertiesPanel.jumpToObjectTr: Sometimes the quick ways to navigate to object tree can interfere with SQL editor usage. These switches are to face such problems.
